doc:
Shelley Hull https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shelley_Hull 0 Shelley Hull (June 17, 1884 - January 14, 1919), born Shelley Vaughan Hull, was an American stage actor who appeared in two motion pictures. His Broadway popularity as a suave handsome leading man was continually on the rise until his early death at age 34 in the Influenza Pandemic of 1918. He was married to actress Josephine Hull. Shelley was a particular favorite of the young Billie Burke and costarred with her in several plays. He had two brothers involved in the theater and films, Howard Hull, who was married to Margaret Anglin, and younger brother Henry Hull, who became a well known actor on stage and in film.Hull is buried in Newton, Massachusetts. Shelley_Hull ( June_17_,_1884 - January_14_,_1919 ) , born Shelley_Vaughan_Hull , was an_American_stage_actor who appeared in two_motion_pictures . His_Broadway_popularity as a_suave_handsome_leading_man was continually on the_rise until his_early_death at age_34 in the_Influenza_Pandemic of 1918 . He was_married to actress_Josephine_Hull . Shelley was a_particular_favorite of the_young_Billie_Burke and costarred with her in several_plays . He had two_brothers involved in the_theater_and_films , Howard_Hull , who was_married to Margaret_Anglin , and younger_brother_Henry_Hull , who became a_well_known_actor on stage and in film.Hull is_buried in Newton , Massachusetts .
